name: %BQUOTE
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

name: %EVAL
description: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using integer arithmetic.

name: %INDEX
description: Returns the position of the first character of a string.

name: %KCMPRES
description: Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

name: %KINDEX
description: Returns the position of the first character of a string.

name: %KLEFT
description: Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

name: %KLENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string.

name: %KSCAN
description: Search for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

name: %KSUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

name: %KUPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

name: %LENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string.

name: %NRBQUOTE
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

name: %NRQUOTE
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

name: %NRSTR
description: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in constant text during macro compilation.

name: %QKCMPRES
description: Compresses multiple blanks and removes leading and trailing blanks.

name: %QKLEFT
description: Left-aligns an argument by removing leading blanks.

name: %QKSCAN
description: Search for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

name: %QKSUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

name: %QKUPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

name: %QSCAN
description: Searches for a word and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %QSUBSTR
description: Produces a substring and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %QSYSFUNC
description: Executes functions and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %QUOTE
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.

name: %QUPCASE
description: Converts a value to uppercase and returns a result that masks special characters and mnemonic operators.

name: %SCAN
description: Searches for a word that is specified by its position in a string.

name: %STR
description: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in constant text at macro compilation.

name: %SUBSTR
description: Produce a substring of a character string.

name: %SUPERQ
description: Masks all special characters and mnemonic operators at macro execution but prevents further resolution of the value.

name: %SYMEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.

name: %SYMGLOBL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is global in scope.

name: %SYMLOCAL
description: Returns an indication as to whether a macro variable is local in scope.

name: %SYSEVALF
description: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using floating-point arithmetic.

name: %SYSFUNC
description: Execute SAS functions or user-written functions.

name: %SYSGET
description: Returns the character string that is the value of the environment variable passed as the argument.

name: %SYSMACEXEC
description: Returns an indication of the execution status of a macro.

name: %SYSMACEXIST
description: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro definition in the Work.SASMacr or Work.SASMacn catalog.

name: %SYSMEXECDEPTH
description: Returns the nesting depth of macro execution from the point of the call to %SYSMEXECDEPTH.

name: %SYSMEXECNAME
description: Returns the name of the macro executing at a requested nesting level.

name: %SYSPROD
description: Reports whether a SAS software product is licensed at the site.

name: %UNQUOTE
description: During macro execution, unmasks all special characters and mnemonic operators for a value.

name: %UPCASE
description: Convert values to uppercase.

name: %VALIDCHS
description: Validates the character(s) encoding compatibility for data set variables.
